channel.title: BBC Middle East
channel.description: Feed from BBC Middle East - with images and summaries

item.title: Iran students stage first large anti-government protests since deadly crackdown
item.description:
Iran students stage first large anti-government protests since deadly crackdown 7 hours ago Share Save Jaroslav Lukiv Share Save Scuffles break out at Sharif University in Tehran Students at several universities in Iran have staged anti-government protests - the first such rallies on this scale since January's deadly crackdown by the authorities. The BBC has verified footage of demonstrators marching on the campus of the Sharif University of Technology in the capital Tehran on Saturday....

item.title: US ambassador's Israel comments condemned by Arab and Muslim nations
item.description:
US ambassador's Israel condemned by Arab and Muslim nations 10 hours ago Share Save Maia Davies Share Save Reuters Mike Huckabee, pictured in September, has long been a supporter of Israel Arab and Muslim governments have condemned remarks made by the US Ambassador to Israel, Mike Huckabee, who suggested Israel would be justified in taking over a vast stretch of the Middle East on Biblical grounds. In an interview with conservative US commentator Tucker Carlson, Huckabee was asked whether.....

item.title: Palestinian Authority in dire straits as Israel's hold on West Bank deepens
item.description:
Palestinian Authority in dire straits as Israel's hold on West Bank deepens 2 days ago Share Save Yolande Knell Middle East correspondent, Ramallah Share Save EPA The Palestinian Authority has delivered little improvement to the lives of Palestinians With Israeli settler violence surging in the occupied West Bank, al-Mughayyir, north-east of Ramallah, has found itself on the frontline. It faces regular incursions by the Israeli army and has seen farmland seized by settlers who have built...

item.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 10 in Lebanon, officials say
item.description:
Israeli strikes kill at least 10 in Lebanon, officials say 1 day ago Share Save Hugo Bachega Middle East correspondent Share Save EPA Israeli air strikes have killed at least 10 people in eastern Lebanon, Lebanese officials say, despite a ceasefire. Israel's military said it had targeted sites belonging to Hezbollah, a Shia Muslim militia and political party, in the Bekaa Valley, an area where the group has a strong presence. Hezbollah confirmed that at least eight of its members had been.....

item.title: Family of Palestinian-American man killed in West Bank demand accountability
item.description:
Family of Palestinian-American man killed in West Bank demand accountability 24 hours ago Share Save Tom Bateman State Department correspondent Share Save Ammar Awad via Reuters The mother of Nasrallah Abu Siyam, 19, grieves at his funeral on Thursday The family of a 19-year-old Palestinian-American man who they say was shot dead by an Israeli settler in the occupied West Bank have called for accountability over his killing. Nasrallah Abu Siyam was shot near the city of Ramallah in the occupied....

item.title: What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios
item.description:
What could happen if the US strikes Iran? Here are seven scenarios 3 days ago Share Save Frank Gardner Security correspondent Share Save EPA US President Donald Trump and Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei The US appears poised to strike Iran. For weeks, Washington has been building up its forces in the Middle East - and now looks set to assemble more air power in the region than at any time since the 2003 invasion of Iraq. This could, of course, still be a bluff designed to...

item.title: Iran's motorcycling midwife and rights campaigner is star of Oscar-tipped film
item.description:
Iran's motorcycling midwife and rights campaigner is star of Oscar-tipped film 2 days ago Share Save Rosa Rahimi Share Save Gandom Films Sara Shahverdi is "doing something unusual" in Iran, filmmakers say Growing up in the Iranian capital Tehran, filmmaker Sara Khaki recalls seeing many examples of strong women in a male-dominated society. These were women "fighting for their independence and demanding space for their lives", she says. She later decided to research female entrepreneurs and....

item.title: Trump's Board of Peace members pledge $7bn in Gaza relief
item.description:
Trump's Board of Peace members pledge $7bn in Gaza relief 3 days ago Share Save Amy Walker and Tom Bateman , State department correspondent, Washington DC Share Save Reuters The UN estimates the cost of damage in Gaza at $70bn Several countries which have signed up to Donald Trump's Board of Peace have contributed more than $7bn (Â£5.2bn) towards a Gaza "relief package", the US president has said. Trump made the announcement during the first meeting of the organisation that many of...

item.title: Trump says he is considering limited military strike on Iran
item.description:
Trump says he is considering limited military strike on Iran 2 days ago Share Save Bernd Debusmann Jr , White House reporter and Cachella Smith Share Save Getty Images Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has said a proposal for an agreement with the US will be ready in days US President Donald Trump has said he is considering a limited military strike on Iran in order to pressure its leaders to agree a deal to curb the nuclear programme. The president made the remark in response to a...

item.title: Hamas holds vote to choose new interim leader, source tells BBC
item.description:
Hamas holds vote to choose new interim leader, source tells BBC 3 days ago Share Save Rushdi Abualouf Gaza correspondent, Istanbul Share Save Reuters Khaled Meshaal, part of Hamas's "old guard", who has already led the group, is said to be one of the frontrunners Hamas is holding an election for a new interim leader, a senior Palestinian official familiar with the armed group's affairs has told the BBC. Voting is taking place across Gaza, the occupied West Bank and among Hamas's.....
